III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 (1) A child caring institution shall establish and
Section follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
Description forms of intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment
including, but not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing,
kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/01/2024, youth was improperly restrained by two staff
members. Both staff members were kneeling on her shoulders.
Youth was not able to breathe at this time. The staff members
then shoved youth after she complained of not being able to
breathe.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/04/2024 an email response was received from the assigned
Foster Care Worker (FCW). She advised that she did not have
any concerns with Vista or placement of youth at the facility.
On 12/04/2024 an in-person interview was held with Compliance.
He was advised of the allegations and the video, medical
documentation and policy information was requested. Compliance
advised that he was familiar with the incident and would make the
Incident Report and video available. He confirmed that the
incident occurred on 11/30/24 and Youth A went to Garden City
Hospital on 12/01/2024. The DHHS specialist discussed and
implemented a safety plan with the agency.
On 12/04/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A. The DHHS specialist was also present. Youth A reported the
incident occurred on the afternoon of October 31, 2024. Youth A
showed a bruise on the inside of her right arm, a scratch on her
right hip and two circular marks on her arm. She reported she
obtained the bruises from a restraint with Staff 1 and Staff 2. She
reported she was sleeping on the couch and was asked to get up
and go to her room. She stated she was angry and was upset at
the way staff was talking to her. She stated she went into the
bathroom and started banging the broom on the walls. Staff 1
came into the restroom and tried to stop her from destroying the
bathroom. She stated he tried to take the broom from her and she
refused to let it go and was “dragged out to the middle of the hall”.
She admitted that she pushed Staff 2 and then Staff 1 and Staff 2
began to restrain her. Youth A stated that they were holding her
2

wrist and twisting her arms. She stated they held her down and
when she dropped to the floor, they kept holding her arms. She
further stated that while she was on the floor, they put their knees
on her shoulders while she was sitting upright on the floor. She
described this as the staff placed their knees near her shoulder
while she was sitting on the floor. Youth A stated she told Staff 1
and Staff 2 that she could not breathe and they still did not release
the restraint. She reported that being restrained caused her to be
“scared”, so she admitted to scratching and grabbing at Staff 1
and Staff 2. She also reported grabbing the hair of Staff 1 and
spitting on both Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth A reported that she now
feels safe at Vista Maria since Staff 2 is no longer in her building.
Youth A denied that other youth were in the area to witness the
incident.
On 12/10/2024 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional concerns.
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 2
at Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 was
advised of the investigation allegations. He recalled that Youth A
was having “issues” that day and described the issues as her
being irate and acting out. Staff 2 left the unit and reported he
thought that Youth A had calmed down. However, he stated when
he left she went into the bathroom and was trying to shatter the
mirror with the broom. He stated that he returned to the wing and
went into the bathroom to escort her out, but she responded to his
request and eventually came out voluntarily. He denied that
Youth A was dragged or pulled out of the bathroom. Staff 2
reported that Staff 1 and Staff 3 were also on the unit and Staff 3
was standing near the bathroom. Once she exited the bathroom,
Youth A pushed Staff 3. Staff 2 reported getting in between the
two of them to deescalate the situation and Youth A stated that
Staff 3 was in her way. He reported Youth A remained escalated
and began to swing at him as she was walking toward him. Staff
2 stated he initially began to back up so that Youth A would not hit
him, but then he and Staff 1 proceeded to place her in a two-
person restraint (upright position). He reported that they both
followed the CPI module while they had Youth A in the restraint.
Staff 2 stated he was on the left side of Youth A and Staff 1 was
on the right side. He reported that whenever Youth A would go to
the floor, they would release her wrist. He reported that she
remained escalated for some time and both He and Staff 1
continued to attempt to verbally deescalate her. He stated he did
not observe any marks or injuries on Youth A and denied that they
ever placed their knees on the shoulders of Youth A during the
3

restraint. Staff 2 denied that he and Staff 1 ever said anything
inappropriate to Youth A, denied they pushed or shoved Youth A
and denied that they have ever been physically inappropriate with
Youth A. Staff 2 was asked about the length of time that Youth A
was held in a restraint. He responded that he did not recall the
length of time each restraint lasted and could not advise what CPI
protocol indicates about appropriate time frame. Staff 2 confirmed
that Youth A stated that she could not breath, but denied seeing
any signs of distress or signs that would support that she was
having difficulty breathing.
The following interviews were completed on 12/17/2024 at
Visita Maria along with DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
stated.
An interview was scheduled with Staff 1, however upon arrival we
were advised that he did not show for his scheduled shift.
An interview was completed with Youth C. She confirmed that
she was placed on the same wing as Youth A. Youth C denied
ever seeing Staff 1 being inappropriate with any of the youth at
Vista Maria. She reported Staff 2 has inappropriately restrained
her once because he was mad that she was trying to leave the
building. She stated he got behind her while she was trying to
leave and his penis touched her butt. She recalled that this was
the first time something like this happened and she does not feel
safe around Staff 2. She denied that she reported this to anyone
else. The concern was reported to centralized intake and is being
investigated by DHHS and DCWL (SI#2025SIC0000225).
An interview was completed with Staff 3. She reported Youth A
was cussing staff out and she was trying to get her to calm down.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were also present. Staff 3 recalled that Youth
A was very escalated and pushed her. Staff 1 and Staff 2
attempted to verbally direct Youth A to stop her behavior. Youth A
began spitting and attempting to hit Staff 1 and Staff 2 and they
initiated a restraint. Staff 3 reported that she then left the wing
because she was a trigger for Youth A. She shared she has
never observed Staff 1 or Staff 2 inappropriately handling Youth A
or any other youth on the wing. She recalled that before she left
the wing, she saw Staff 1 and Staff 2 begin a two-man restraint on
Youth A. She explained that they each had hold of the wrists of
Youth A. Staff 3 denied that she has ever seen Staff 1 or Staff 2
place their knees on a youth when restraining.
4

An interview was completed with Youth B. Youth B confirmed
that she resides on the wing with Youth A and was on the wing the
day of the incident. She recalls Youth A broke the window in the
bathroom because she was bored. She reported Youth A was
hitting Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth B was taken to the
sensory room away from the incident. She denied knowing what
happened after that. She denied seeing Staff 1 or Staff 2
inappropriately restrain Youth A and denied ever seeing them be
inappropriate with Youth at Vista Maria.
On 12/18/2024 and 12/23/2024 an attempt to contact Staff 1 via
telephone was unsuccessful. Message indicated that subscriber
is not in service. Unable to leave a message.
On 12/23/2024 a telephone conversation was held with DHHS
Specialist. She advised that she had spoken with Compliance
and he confirmed that Staff 1 was terminated and provided his last
known address.
On 01/06/2024 a MIC Dispo Case Conference was held with
DHHS Specialist, Area Manager, FCW, DHHS Supervisor and
myself. DHHS reported no findings or concerns of abuse or
neglect.
On 01/06/2024 an unsuccessful telephone call was made to Staff
4. Voicemail message left for a return call to discuss incident that
occurred at Vista Maria.
Video Review:
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were observed in the video on 11/31/2024 at
7:11pm initiating a restraint of Youth A. Youth A is observed
pushing Staff 3 along with hitting Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 are observed completing an appropriate two-person
restraint on Youth A based on protocol. The staff were standing
on each side of Youth A and were holding her wrists. It appears
that staff are attempting to verbally de-escalate Youth A and she
continues to hit and punch at the staff. It further shows Staff 1 and
Staff 2 putting their hands on the shoulders of Youth A to extend
her arms out. The video does not show Staff 1 and Staff 2 putting
their knees on the shoulders of Youth A. Youth A was observed
to be very escalated during the video and continued to make
attempts to hit and spit at staff. Youth A was observed to be
maintained in a restraint for almost 4 minutes.
Documents Reviewed:
5

Medical of Youth A Dated 12/01/2024 – Medical report indicates
youth presents from Vista Maria for aggressive behavior and right
foot pain. Patient was treated and provided Tylenol for pain. An x-
ray was completed and no concerns noted. Patient noted to be
calm upon discharge. No prescription were provided upon
discharge.
Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – Physical or safety
intervention techniques will be utilized as an absolute last resort.
Staff are only permitted to utilize approved behavior management
techniques as taught by a certified Crisis Prevention Institute
trainer.
DHHS SW Contact – On 01/16/2025 a telephone interview held
with Staff 4 by DHHS Specialist. Staff 4 confirmed being at work
on the date of the incident with Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2. She
disclosed she switched out with Staff 3 due to Youth A becoming
physical with Staff 3. She reported once she came on the wing,
she observed Youth A being violent, hitting and spitting on Staff 1
and Staff 2. She disclosed she observed Staff 1 and Staff 2
completing the physical management on Youth A while she was in
an upright position. Staff 4 indicated she never observed the staff
inappropriately restraining Youth A. She added that each time
Youth A went to the floor (dropped her weight) the staff released
the restraint. Staff 4 reported she has never heard the staff or
youth say Staff 1 or Staff 2 did not follow CPI or handled any of
the girls in a manner that would cause injury. Staff 4 further
disclosed she transported Youth A to Garden City Hospital after
the incident on 12/01/2024. She disclosed Youth A had an x ray
completed and showed medical providers the injury on her right
forearm. Staff 4 disclosed the injury on Youth A’s right forearm,
which was a bruise, was from a previous incident of fighting with
peers, and her description matched the bruise observed by DHHS
on Youth A’s right forearm.
Medical of Youth A Dated 11/25/2024 – Medical report indicates
Youth A was seen and found to have a small bruise on her
forearm after being restrained. This incident is being addressed
under SI# 2025SIC0000301.
DHHS SW Contact – On 01/16/2025 a telephone interview was
completed with Staff 1 by DHHS Specialist. DHHS went over the
allegations with Staff 1. He reported he never inappropriately
handled Youth A on the day of the incident. He stated on
12/01/2024 Youth A was upset for some reason; she went in the
bathroom and began breaking the glass. He shared he redirected
6

her and contacted maintenance to fix the mirror. Staff 1 explained
Youth A became mad and her behaviors escalated. She began
hitting Staff 2 and him along with spitting on them. He also
disclosed that Youth A pushed Staff 3 as well. Staff 1 revealed he
and Staff 2 put Youth A in a two person restraint while she was
standing. He indicated each time Youth A calmed down they
would release her then she would become aggressive toward
staff. Staff 1 shared he really does not remember much because
it was a few months ago. He stated during the incident they
followed the CPI module and never caused harm to Youth A. He
denied seeing any injuries on Youth A after the incident. Staff 1
denied he or Staff 2 put their knees on Youth A’s shoulder.
He stated that both he and Staff 2 made attempts to verbally
deescalate Youth A prior to initiating the restraint. Staff 1
confirmed he was no longer employed with Vista Maria, but stated
he did not want to discuss the details.
CPI Training Materials – Protocol indicates that a two person
restraint involves an individual on either side of the youth,
maintaining close body contact with the youth. Arms can be
across the body of the youth and staff should secure youth to their
hips. Lastly, hands of staff can be on the shoulder of the youth in
a c-shape position to direct the shoulders forward.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the identified licensing rule. There was no
evidence to support that staff placed their knees on the shoulders
of the youth. This was not viewed in the video and interviews with
staff denied that this occurred.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is found to be in compliance with all
applicable licensing statutes and rules.
